foundations.name: Foundations
foundations.description: Master the basics of your product positioning and sales approach

1.1.title: The Elevator Pitch
1.1.lesson:
Your elevator pitch should be 30 seconds max. Lead with the problem you solve, not what you do.

Bad: 'We're an AI-powered platform that...'
Good: 'Companies waste 200+ hours on due diligence. We cut that to 20.'

scenario.title: VP of Business Development
scenario.context: Networking event. You have 30 seconds before they move on.
scenario.message: So, what does your company do exactly?

criteria.name: Problem-first framing
criteria.description: Led with the problem, not the solution

criteria.name: Clear CTA
criteria.description: Ended with a next step or hook

1.2.title: Handling 'Not Interested'
1.2.lesson:
When someone says 'not interested', they usually mean 'you haven't shown me why I should be interested yet.' Don't give up — reframe.

Key technique: Acknowledge, then pivot to a question that reveals their actual pain point.

scenario.title: Head of Corporate Development
scenario.context: Cold LinkedIn outreach. Sarah responded briefly.
scenario.message: Thanks but we're not looking for anything like this right now.

criteria.name: Curiosity question
criteria.description: Asked a question to understand their situation

criteria.name: Value reframe
criteria.description: Reframed the value prop from their perspective

scenarios.title: The Skeptical PE Partner
scenarios.company_context: PE firm, $5B AUM, enterprise software focus
scenarios.setting: Conference cocktail hour. Introduced by mutual contact.
scenarios.message: I've heard the name. But we have our own deal sourcing team. We see 500 deals a year. What could you show us that we haven't seen?

criteria.name: Acknowledged their strength
criteria.description: Validated their deal flow before positioning

criteria.name: Specific differentiator
criteria.description: Named something specific they can't get elsewhere

scenarios.title: The Price-Sensitive Founder
scenarios.company_context: Series B startup, 80 employees, considering strategic options
scenarios.setting: Zoom call. She reached out after seeing your LinkedIn content.
scenarios.message: I like what you're doing, but honestly, we're bootstrapped on the advisory side. What are your fees? I've heard M&A advisors take 5-10% and that feels steep for what we need right now.

criteria.name: Value reframe
criteria.description: Shifted focus from cost to value/time saved

criteria.name: Pricing clarity
criteria.description: Explained fee structure clearly and honestly

criteria.name: Risk removal
criteria.description: Addressed the 'what if it doesn't work' concern

criteria.name: Urgency/timing
criteria.description: Mentioned why now is the right time to explore
